answers.author: Philip Munck
answers.text:
New Hampshire law prohibits municipalities from giving money to anyone (except for welfare).  They can, however, give money for services rendered.  Thus a city might give money to a homeless shelter in a neighboring town after that shelter demonstrates that it provides homeless shelter to residents of the city.  There is no obligation to reimburse an agency for any or all of their expenses.  Applications for inclusion in budgets are generally required to provide explicit information about the services rendered to the community being applied to.
